definitions: To make the motions of boxing without landing heavy blows, typically as a form of training or practice.
To engage in a dispute or argument, especially a minor or playful one.
To strike or fight with feet or spurs, as cocks do.
To shut, to fasten, to bar.
examples: The boxers sparred for an hour.
They sparred over the last piece of cake.
The roosters sparred in the yard.
